aboutAppContent: The application for assessing the critical condition of patients in the emergency department of Thammasat Chaloem Phra Kiat Hospital is a newly developed software designed as a tool for evaluating the critical condition of patients using the MEWS score calculation method, which will replace the manual tool used for recording patient crisis condition assessments.
name: Name
nurseIDMustBeANumber: Nurse ID must be a number!
nursingHigh:
• Observe and assess the patient's condition, record V/S every 15-30 minutes, and monitor according to nursing standards. Report to the shift supervisor and provide nursing care as appropriate.
• Report to Intern doctor or 1st call to assess the patient's condition within 30 minutes and provide medical instructions.
• Assess the patient and record V/S every 30 minutes for 3 consecutive times. If the MEWS score remains 5 for 3 consecutive times, record V/S every 15 minutes.
• If the condition does not improve, report to 2nd call/3rd call doctor to assess the patient within 15 minutes and provide medical instructions.
• Consider increasing recording of I/O every 2 hours. If urine output is < 50 cc in 2 hours, report to the doctor.
• If the MEWS score remains 5 for 3 consecutive times, consult the doctor to consider transferring the patient to the critical care unit.
nursingLow: • Observe and assess the patient's condition, record V/S every 8 hours, and monitor according to nursing standards.
nursingLowMedium:
• Observe and assess the patient's condition, record V/S every 4 hours, and monitor according to nursing standards. Report to the shift supervisor.
• Report to Intern doctor or 1st call to assess the patient's condition within 30 minutes and provide medical instructions.
nursingMedium:
• Observe and assess the patient's condition, record V/S every 2 hours, and monitor according to nursing standards. Report to the shift supervisor and provide nursing care as appropriate.
• Report to Intern doctor or 1st call to assess the patient's condition within 30 minutes and provide medical instructions.
• Assess the patient and record V/S every 2 hours for 3 consecutive times. If the MEWS score remains 3 for 3 consecutive times, record V/S every 1 hour.
• If the condition does not improve, report to 2nd call/3rd call doctor to assess the patient within 30 minutes and provide medical instructions.
nursingMediumHigh:
• Observe and assess the patient's condition, record V/S every 30 minutes to 1 hour, and monitor according to nursing standards. Report to the shift supervisor and provide nursing care as appropriate.
• Report to Intern doctor or 1st call to assess the patient's condition within 30 minutes and provide medical instructions.
• Assess the patient and record V/S every 1 hour for 3 consecutive times. If the MEWS score remains 4 for 3 consecutive times, record V/S every 15-30 minutes.
• If the condition does not improve, report to 2nd call/3rd call doctor to assess the patient within 15 minutes and provide medical instructions.
• Consider increasing recording of I/O every 4 hours. If urine output is < 100 cc in 4 hours, report to the doctor.
passwordWarning: Password must be at least 6 characters
proceed?: Are you sure you want to proceed?
